sectiondef.header: Functions returning variables that are calculated from 4-momentum

description.para: information from constituents. The 4-momentum is calculated as the sum of 4-momenta of all the constituent particles whos indices are given in the vector. If one of the indices is -1, then missingET will also be used with pz=0 and E=sqrt(mpx*mpx + mpy*mpy).

briefdescription.para: The total 4-momentum.

sectiondef.header: Functions returning variables that are calculated from

description.para: information from constituents (not only using their 4-momenta).

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< std::string > &varNames, const std::vector< int > &partIndices={}) const
memberdef.name: weight

detaileddescription.para: Get the weight for this xAOD::CompositeParticle by providing a vector of variable names that will be looked for. These variables, if found, are assumed to be of type float and to hold a multiplicative weight variable. If a given variable name is not found for this xAOD::CompositeParticle, then, the whole constituent tree will be searched for iteratively. The same variable name can be found and used for several constituents. But if a xAOD::CompositeParticle has that variable, the iterative search will not look into the constituents of that xAOD::CompositeParticle. The second, optional, argument is a list of indices such that one can restrict the variable name search to only the given constituent particles.

Get the weight for this xAOD::CompositeParticle. This specialization to the above method is needed since ROOT 6.02 doesn't yet support C++11 in the TFormula stuff with JIT compilation, see: https://sft.its.cern.ch/jira/browse/ROOT-5083

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &varNameA, const std::string &varNameB, const std::string &varNameC) const
memberdef.name: weight

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &varNameA, const std::string &varNameB, const std::string &varNameC, const std::string &varNameD) const
memberdef.name: weight

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &varNameA, const std::string &varNameB, const std::string &varNameC, const std::string &varNameD, const std::string &varNameE) const
memberdef.name: weight

briefdescription.para: This is a private helper method to calculate the weight.
Add a particle as an additional constituent. Note that the 4-momentum of this CompositeParticle will be updated accordingly, if updateFourMom=true.
Add a particle as an additional constituent. Note that the 4-momentum of this CompositeParticle will be updated accordingly, if updateFourMom=true.

Remove a particle as a constituent from this CompostiteParticle. Note that the 4-momentum of this CompositeParticle will be updated accordingly, if updateFourMom=true. If the given IParticle is not already a constituent of this CompositeParticle, nothing happens.

Get the MissingET object that is associated with this CompositeParticle. If no (valid) MissingET object is associated with this CompositeParticle, a null pointer will be returned.
Set the MissingET for this CompositeParticle. Note that the 4-momentum of this CompositeParticle will be updated accordingly, if updateFourMom=true.
Remove the existing MissingET object from this CompositeParticle. Note that the 4-momentum of this CompositeParticle will be updated accordingly, if updateFourMom=true.

detaileddescription.para: Number of constituent particles. Note that MissingET is NOT counted as a constituent in this context

detaileddescription.para: Method to return a DataVector<T>, e.g., a MuonContainer, for all the constituent particles, e.g., of type xAOD::Muon, that this CompositeParticle has. This DataVector be a simple SG::VIEW_ELEMENTS container, i.e., it does NOT own the elements, e.g., muons, but has simple pointers to them. However, the user is still required to take care of its memory management by either recording it to StoreGate (and thus transfering ownership), or by deleting this view-container when done with it.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< int > &partIndices, const std::vector< int > &otherPartIndices=std::vector< int >{}, bool updateFourMom=true) const
memberdef.name: compPart

detaileddescription.para: Get a CompositeParticle that is build on the fly from the constituent particles associated to the indices given (missingET is at index=-1). If the second list of idices is given, also the "other" particles will be used in building this CompositeParticle.

memberdef.argsstring: (int partIndexA, int partIndexB, int partIndexC=-2, bool updateFourMom=true) const

detaileddescription.para: Get a CompositeParticle that is build on the fly from the constituent particles associated to the indices given (missingET is at index=-1). This specialization to the above method is needed since ROOT 6.02 doesn't yet support C++11 in the TFormula stuff with JIT compilation, see: https://sft.its.cern.ch/jira/browse/ROOT-5083

Get the constituent number i as a TruthParticle. If the cast to TruthParticle fails for a constituent, a null pointer is returned.

sectiondef.header: Functions implementing handling of other constituents. These

description.para: The constituent iterators are missing for the moment

other particles are stored separetely from the main constituent particles. They will NOT be used to determine the four-momentum of this CompositeParticle. And they will NOT be used for determining the weight (and other properties) of this CompositeParticle. The main idea is that these other particles can be used for keeping track of, e.g., a third lepton to veto on, or sub-threshold jets.

Description of a composite particle, i.e. a particle that is composed out of several other particles/objects, e.g., a Z boson that consists out of two muons.
